sentences.english: She was my BFF on the show and in real life.
sentences.chinese: 不管在節目上，還是實際生活中，她都是我的死黨。

sentences.english: Joey and his buddies kicked off their summer vacation with a trip to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 喬伊和他的死黨以一場海灘之旅來爲璁假揭開序幕。

sentences.english: Yet Mr. Zhao’s compromises have damaged some of his closest friendships in China.
sentences.chinese: 不過，趙亮的妥協行爲摧毀了國內一些死黨關係。

sentences.english: I now have peace calling my former Best Friend a really good friend.
sentences.chinese: 我現在可以平靜地稱以往的死黨爲好朋友。

sentences.english: I have had a Best Friend for at 28 years now.
sentences.chinese: 我曾有個死黨，至今已28年。

sentences.english: No words don't talk about chums, beautiful girlfriend, suitable work?
sentences.chinese: 無話不談的死黨，漂亮的女朋友，合適的工作？

sentences.english: At times, I felt that my Best Friend was very selfish.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我甚至覺得我的死黨非常自私。

definition: Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
the opposite sex/of the opposite sex/heterosexual/different in nature
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
